concept.title: Permissions
concept.shortdesc: Permissions are one of the cornerstones of security by controlling user access. Permissions determine the tasks that users can perform. Depending on the responsibilities of the user, you can restrict or broaden the tasks that they can perform.

conbody.p: Permissions are not assigned directly to users which is what gives flexibility in your environment. Instead, permissions are granted through a set of defined roles. Roles are assigned to users within a team. This model allows you to give a user a set of permissions for one team that is different from the set given to the same user on another team. A person or group might have different responsibilities for the different teams they are members.

The interlocking concept of teams, roles, and permissions ensures that users have the appropriate permissions to perform their work and not affect processes outside of their assigned scope. The interaction of these three concepts provides the mechanisms to create an infrastructure that is secure and flexible.

Permissions give users access to tasks limited to the following categories:
Pipelines
Releases
Teams
Product
